revised_title: Gamma-Ray Scattering in Extended Media: Problems with Spherical Symmetry
tldr: The authors studied the scattering of gamma-rays in extended media with spherical symmetry, focusing on Compton scattering for substances of medium and low atomic weight. They explored various scenarios, including a point source in an infinite homogeneous medium, a semi-infinite medium with a plane face, and an empty sphere around the point source. The results provide insights into the behavior of gamma-radiation in radiography and other applications.
